New Records: Anthony Edwards scored a season-high 37 points
Key Match Events: The Timberwolves scored the game's first 10 points
Portland Trail Blazers missed their first 10 shots
Edwards scored 19 points in the third quarter to put the game away for good
The Wolves opened the second quarter on an 11-2 run
Portland answered with a 13-0 run to get back in it
Post-Match Reflections: Edwards said of his hot shooting, 'I'm not like shocked or anything because I worked so hard for it. I worked so hard on my trey ball, so it's like, 'Here we go, this is what's supposed to happen.' Hopefully it keep going that way.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rudy Gobert set the defensive tone early for the Wolves, recording all three of his blocks in the game's opening minutes
Gobert finished with eight points, 15 rebounds and the three blocks, grabbing his 9,000th career rebound in the process
The sold-out Target Center crowd was electric when Dillingham drilled a 3-pointer, the first of his career, with just under four minutes to play
Dillingham finished with seven points on 3-for-3 shooting, two assists and three rebounds in six minutes
Others: The win is Minnesota's third straight
The Timberwolves dominated from start to finish and never trailed on their way to a 127-102 victory
